title: "Hands-on Exercise 1: Geospatial Data Wrangling with R"
execute: 
  warning: false
date: 01/08/2024
date-format: "DD/MM/YYYY"
---


# Getting Started

## Installing and loading R packages

In this section, I will install and load tidyverse and sf packages.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, sf)
```
:::


# Importing a geospatial data in shapefile format


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "/dljyuan/IS415-GAA/data/geospatial", 
                layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\dljyuan\IS415-GAA\data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::


## **Plotting the Geospatial Data**

Hide Plot Show Code Only


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(mpsz)
```
:::

# Importing another geospatial data in shapefile format


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
cyclingpath = st_read(dsn = "/dljyuan/IS415-GAA/data/geospatial", 
                         layer = "CyclingPathGazette")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `CyclingPathGazette' from data source 
  `C:\dljyuan\IS415-GAA\data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 2558 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTILINESTRING
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 11854.32 ymin: 28347.98 xmax: 42626.09 ymax: 48948.15
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::


# Importing GIS data in kml format


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool = st_read("/dljyuan/IS415-GAA/data/geospatial/PreSchoolsLocation.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `PRESCHOOLS_LOCATION' from data source 
  `C:\dljyuan\IS415-GAA\data\geospatial\PreSchoolsLocation.kml' 
  using driver `KML'

Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6878 ymin: 1.247759 xmax: 103.9897 ymax: 1.462134
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


# Checking the Content of A Simple Feature Data Frame

The column in the sf data.frame that contains the geometries is a list, of class sfc.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_geometry(mpsz)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Geometry set for 323 features 
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
First 5 geometries:
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz$geom
```

# Assigning EPSG code to a simple feature data frame

One of the common issue that can happen during importing geospatial data into R is that the coordinate system of the source data was either missing (such as due to missing .proj for ESRI shapefile) or wrongly assigned during the importing process.

**Wrong EPSG Code**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: SVY21 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21[WGS84]",
        DATUM["World Geodetic System 1984",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
            ID["EPSG",6326]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]],
    CONVERSION["unnamed",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["(E)",east,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]],
        AXIS["(N)",north,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1,
                ID["EPSG",9001]]]]
```


:::
:::


**Assigning correct EPSG Code**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414 <- st_set_crs(mpsz, 3414)
st_crs(mpsz3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Coordinate Reference System:
  User input: EPSG:3414 
  wkt:
PROJCRS["SVY21 / Singapore TM",
    BASEGEOGCRS["SVY21",
        DATUM["SVY21",
            ELLIPSOID["WGS 84",6378137,298.257223563,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        ID["EPSG",4757]],
    CONVERSION["Singapore Transverse Mercator",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",1.36666666666667,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",103.833333333333,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",1,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",28001.642,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",38744.572,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["northing (N)",north,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
        AXIS["easting (E)",east,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
    USAGE[
        SCOPE["Cadastre, engineering survey, topographic mapping."],
        AREA["Singapore - onshore and offshore."],
        BBOX[1.13,103.59,1.47,104.07]],
    ID["EPSG",3414]]
```


:::
:::


# Transforming the projection from wgs84 to svy21.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
preschool3414 <- st_transform(preschool, 
                              crs = 3414)
```
:::


# Importing the aspatial data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings <- read_csv("/dljyuan/IS415-GAA/data/aspatial/listings.csv")
list(listings) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


:::
:::


# Creating a simple feature data frame from an aspatial data frame


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
listings_sf <- st_as_sf(listings, 
                       coords = c("longitude", "latitude"),
                       crs=4326) %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```
:::


Examine the content of this newly created simple feature data frame


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
glimpse(listings_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


:::
:::


# Geoprocessing with sf package

**Buffering**

The scenario:

The authority is planning to upgrade the exiting cycling path. To do so, they need to acquire 5 metres of reserved land on the both sides of the current cycling path. You are tasked to determine the extend of the land need to be acquired and their total area.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
buffer_cycling <- st_buffer(cyclingpath, 
                               dist=5, nQuadSegs = 30)
buffer_cycling$AREA <- st_area(buffer_cycling)
sum(buffer_cycling$AREA)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
1774367 [m^2]
```


:::
:::


**Point-in-polygon count**

The scenario:

A pre-school service group want to find out the numbers of pre-schools in each Planning Subzone.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`<- lengths(st_intersects(mpsz3414, preschool3414))
summary(mpsz3414$`PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
   Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
   0.00    0.00    4.00    7.09   10.00   72.00 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
top_n(mpsz3414, 1, `PreSch Count`)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 16 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 39655.33 ymin: 35966 xmax: 42940.57 ymax: 38622.37
Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM
  OBJECTID SUBZONE_NO     SUBZONE_N SUBZONE_C CA_IND PLN_AREA_N PLN_AREA_C
1      189          2 TAMPINES EAST    TMSZ02      N   TAMPINES         TM
     REGION_N REGION_C          INC_CRC FMEL_UPD_D   X_ADDR   Y_ADDR SHAPE_Leng
1 EAST REGION       ER 21658EAAF84F4D8D 2014-12-05 41122.55 37392.39   10180.62
  SHAPE_Area                       geometry PreSch Count
1    4339824 MULTIPOLYGON (((42196.76 38...           72
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz3414$Area <- mpsz3414 %>%
  st_area()
mpsz3414 <- mpsz3414 %>%
  mutate(`PreSch Density` = `PreSch Count`/Area * 1000000)
```
:::


# Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mpsz3414$`PreSch Density`)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


ggplot2 Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  labs(title = "Are pre-school even distributed in Singapore?",
       subtitle= "There are many planning sub-zones with a single pre-school, on the other hand, \nthere are two planning sub-zones with at least 20 pre-schools",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Frequency")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


ggplot2 Scattered Plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=mpsz3414, 
       aes(y = `PreSch Count`, 
           x= as.numeric(`PreSch Density`)))+
  geom_point(color="black", 
             fill="light blue") +
  xlim(0, 40) +
  ylim(0, 40) +
  labs(title = "",
      x = "Pre-school density (per km sq)",
      y = "Pre-school count")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex01_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
